Basic Table

Basic tables only require row and column data.

HTML:

<filamentui-table
    rows="basicTable.rows"
    cols="basicTable.cols">
</filamentui-table>

JS:


        

    


    
    

        
Basic Table with Tags

        

            
            
        

        

            
Basic tables only require row and column data. Tags are generated elements that can be given a limit of how many tags to display directly in the table.

            
HTML:

            
<filamentui-table
    rows="tagTable.rows"
    cols="tagTable.cols">
</filamentui-table>
            

            
Table Column:

            
{
    'id': 3,
    'firstName': 'Ash',
    'surname': 'Ketchum',
    'tag': {
        'type': 'filamentui-tags',
        'data': {
            'tags': [...],
            'top': 3
        }
    }
}
            

            
JS:

            

        

    


    
    

        
Sorted Table

        

            
            
        

        

            
Sorted tables require a sorts option in column data. You can optionally pass a sortFunction to sort more complex objects or reverse sorting.

            
You can pass a defaultSort option to set default sorting.

            
HTML:

            
<filamentui-table
    rows="sortedTable.rows"
    cols="sortedTable.cols"
    options="sortedTable.options">
</filamentui-table>
            

            
Table columns:

            
[
    {
        'title': 'First Name',
        'width': '200px',
        'key': 'firstName',
        'sorts': ['A - Z', 'Z - A']
    }, {
        'title': 'Surname',
        'width': '200px',
        'key': 'surname',
        'sorts': ['A - Z', 'Z - A']
    }, {
        'title': 'Count',
        'width': 'auto',
        'key': 'count',
        'sorts': ['Decreasing', 'Increasing'],
        'sortFunction': function (item) {
            return -item.count;
        }
    }
]
            

            
Options:

            

        

    


    
    

        
Filtered Table

        

            
            
        

        

            
Filters can be added to columns. Each filter uses the column's key for filtering and requires a value to match on.

            
Filter title is optional, if it's not set it will be set to the filter value.

            
Filter options include strict for strict equality and complexMatch for matching on any key and doing nested matches.

            
Can't filter using a filter function yet.

            
Table columns:

            

        

        

    


    
    

        
Generated Items Table

        

            
            
        

        

            
Generated items can be used as row items to add directives inside the table.

            
You should be able to use complexMatch filter to sort on these objects, but for some reason it's not working in this demo.

            
Table row example:

            

            
Options:

            

        

    


    
    

        
Selectable Table

        

            
            
        

        

            
Use selectable option to make table selectable. Selection assumes that your data has id values, else it will not work.

            
Rows that are selected are set to the ng-model variable

            
HTML:

            
<filamentui-table
    rows="selectableTable.rows"
    cols="selectableTable.cols"
    options="selectableTable.options"
    ng-model="selectableTable.selected">
</filamentui-table>
            

            
Options:

            

            
Selected items:

            

        

    


    
    

        
Multiple Selectable Table

        

            
            
        

        

            
Use multiple option to be able to select multiple rows. Selection assumes that your data has id values, else it will not work.

            
Rows that are selected are set to the ng-model variable

            
HTML:

            
<filamentui-table
    rows="multipleTable.rows"
    cols="multipleTable.cols"
    options="multipleTable.options"
    ng-model="multipleTable.selected">
</filamentui-table>
            

            
Options:

            

            
Selected items:

            

        

    


    
    

        
Preselected Multiple Selectable Table

        

            
            
        

        

            
Use row._meta.checked to define if a row is selected. Selection assumes that your data has id values, else it will not work.

            
These rows will automatically populate the ng-model.

            
HTML:

            
<filamentui-table
    rows="preselectedTable.rows"
    cols="preselectedTable.cols"
    options="preselectedTable.options"
    ng-model="preselectedTable.selected">
</filamentui-table>
            

            
Options:

            

            
Selected items:

            

        

    


    
    

        
Basic Expandable Table

        

            
            
        

        

            
Use expandable option to be able to expand row on click.

            
HTML:

            
<filamentui-table
    rows="basicExpandableTable.rows"
    cols="basicExpandableTable.cols"
    options="basicExpandableTable.options">
</filamentui-table>
            

            
Options:

            

            
Set the expandedContent property on each row with the data you want to be in the expanded section.

            
row.expandedContent = 'hello world';
            

        

    


    
    

        
Generated Content Expandable Table

        

            
            
        

        

            
Use expandable option to be able to expand row on click.

            
HTML:

            
<filamentui-table
    rows="expandableTable.rows"
    cols="expandableTable.cols"
    options="expandableTable.options">
</filamentui-table>
            

            
Options:

            

            
Set the expandedContent property on each row with the data you want to be in the expanded section.

            
row.expandedContent = {
    'type': 'filamentui-json',
    'data': {
        'json': { 'hello': 'world' }
    }
};
            

        

    


    
    

        
Subtable Table

        

            
            
        

        

            
You can nest tables within other tables.

            
Set row.expanded to true if you want it to be expanded by default.

            
HTML:

            
<filamentui-table
    rows="subtableTable.rows"
    cols="subtableTable.cols"
    options="subtableTable.options">
</filamentui-table>
            

            
Options:

            

            
Set the expandedContent property on each row with the data you want to be in the expanded section.

            
row.expandedContent = {
    'type': 'filamentui-table',
    'data': {
        'rows': angular.copy(basicRawData),
        'cols': angular.copy(basicRawCols),
        'options': {
            'hideHeaders': true,
            'hidePager': true
        }
    }
};
            

        

    


    
    

        
Selectable Subtable Table

        

            
            
        

        

            
Options:

            

            
Selected items:

            

            
Subtable selected items:

            

        

    


    
    

        
No Headers Table

        

            
            
        

        

            
Use hideHeaders option to hide headers on the table.

            
HTML:

            
<filamentui-table
    rows="noHeadersTable.rows"
    cols="noHeadersTable.cols"
    options="noHeadersTable.options">
</filamentui-table>
            

            
Options:

            

        

    


    
    

        
Actions Table

        

            
            
        

        

            
If you provide an actions property then a column at the end will be added. This will place a menu in the final column for each row that adds context specific actions defined in that actions variable.

            
If you also provide a clickActionIndex option, each row in the table becomes clickable, assuming that action can be performed based on the provided actions if block. The indexing will only search on the first action group of the table.

            
Actions:

            

            
Example Action:

            
{
    'title': 'First action',
    'icon': 'fa-edit',
    'action': function (item) {
        alert('You clicked on the first action.');
    },
    'if': function (item) {
        return true;
    }
}
            

            
Options:

            

        

    


    
    

        
Asynchronous Table

        Get Rows

        

            
            
        

        

            
Rows accepts an asynchronous function that can be called at any time.

            
function asyncGetRows() {
    return $q(function(resolve, reject) {
        setTimeout(function() {
            resolve({
                items: angular.copy(basicRawData)
            });
        }, 1000);
    });
}

$scope.asynchronousTable = {
    'rows': asyncGetRows
};
